Package jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework

Class AbstractInfo

java.lang.Object
jdk.test.lib.hotspot.ir_framework.AbstractInfo
Direct Known Subclasses:
RunInfo, TestInfo
public abstract class AbstractInfo extends Object
Base info class which provides some useful utility methods and information about a test.

Base tests and checked tests use TestInfo while custom run tests use RunInfo.

See Also:
Test, Check, Run

  • Method Details

    • toggleBoolean

      public boolean toggleBoolean()
      Returns a different boolean each time this method is invoked (switching between false and true). The first invocation returns false.
      Returns:
      an inverted boolean of the result of the last invocation of this method.

    • getRandom

      public Random getRandom()
      Get the initialized Random object.
      Returns:
      the random object.

    • isWarmUp

      public boolean isWarmUp()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the framework is currently warming up the associated test.
      Returns:
      the warm-up status of the associated test.
      See Also:
      Warmup

    • getMethod

      public Method getMethod​(Class<?> c, String name, Class<?>... args)
      Get the method object of the method name of class c with arguments args.
      Parameters:
      c - the class containing the method.
      name - the name of the method.
      args - the arguments of the method, leave empty if no arguments.
      Returns:
      the method object of the requested method.

    • getTestClassMethod

      public Method getTestClassMethod​(String name, Class<?>... args)
      Get the method object of the method name of the test class with arguments args.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the method in the test class.
      args - the arguments of the method, leave empty if no arguments.
      Returns:
      the method object of the requested method in the test class.

    • isC2CompilationEnabled

      public boolean isC2CompilationEnabled()
      Returns a boolean indicating if the test VM runs with flags that allow C2 compilations.
      Returns:
      true if C2 compilations are allowed; false otherwise (run with -XX:TieredStopAtLevel={1,2,3}, -XX:-UseCompiler).
